description: From Russian борзо́й (borzój), from борзый (borzyj, “swift”), from Proto-Indo-European *mréǵʰus (whence English brief, brace and merry).

entries.meaning: A dog of a particular breed, similar in shape to a greyhound but with longer silkier hair.
examples: Synonyms: Russian Hunting Sighthound, Russian Wolfhound
